heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes was on 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 07 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles was the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 11.4°C) and outside temperature (down 10.2°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 949 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 15.2°C), dew point temperature (up 9.7°C), outside temperature (up 12.5°C), and cloud levels (up 860 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 948.8m lower than yesterday, 350.6m lower than the past week, 860.3m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 928m minimum and 5160m maximum, with an average of 1585.5m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1936.1m and 2450m.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry and less humid conditions and little or no wind. Showers, occasional overcast conditions, and it’s dim outside. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.
